text: {| |} RFA King Salvor (A291), initially HMS King Salvor (W191),http://www.uboat.net/allies/warships/ship/7713.html was the lead ship of a class of 12 salvage vessels of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary. A 13th ship was completed as a submarine rescue vessel for the Royal Navy as . King Salvor was built by Wm. Simons & Co. Ltd. of Renfrew as Allegiance, launched on 18 May 1942, and commissioned on 17 July 1942. The ship converted into a submarine rescue bell and target ship, and renamed HMS Kingfisher in April 1954. Decommissioned in 1960, the ship was sold to the Argentine Navy in December 1960 and renamed Tehuelche in 1961, Guardiamarina Zicari in 1963, and disposed of in 1974. ==Notes== ==External links== *King Salvor class *http://www.uboat.net/allies/warships/class.html?ID=375 Category:King Salvor- class salvage vessels Category:Ships built on the River Clyde Category:1942 ships
title: RFA King Salvor (A291)
